meanings.sent1: The tape will clag the papers together.
meanings.sent2: The mud clagged to his shoes as he walked through the field.
meanings.sent3: Trying to pull the two magnets apart was like watching them clag together in a magnetic dance.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to clag to his mind, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The paintbrush seemed to clag to the canvas, creating a beautiful masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: She used the clag to stick the pieces of paper together.
meanings.sent2: The tree sap acted as a natural clag, holding the leaves in place.
meanings.sent3: The clag on the sticker made it impossible to remove without tearing the paper.
meanings.sent4: The clag on the tape held the package securely in place during shipping.
meanings.sent5: The clag on the bandage helped it stay in position on the wound.

meanings.sent1: The drain started to clag with leaves after the storm.
meanings.sent2: The traffic clagged up as the cars slowed down to merge onto the highway.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to fix the clock only caused it to clag up further, now showing the wrong time.
meanings.sent4: The river clagged with debris after the heavy rain, causing a temporary blockage.
meanings.sent5: The printer clagged up with paper, halting the printing process.
